Method Detail

getInteger

public java.lang.Integer getInteger(java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
get an Integer object corresponding to the passed <name> argument. It searches the keys it knows for an appearance of <name>, but if it cannot find one, it starts dropping parts of the <name> (separated by "." character) from left to right, until it finds a match. This match must then be "mappable" to an int, else it throws IllegalArgumentException. If no match can be found, it returns null.

Parameters:
name - String
Returns:
Integer
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject(java.lang.String name)
same logic as in getInteger(name), but this time it just returns whatever object best matches the input <name>.
